gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.17/hr signals persistent supply chain bottlenecks, with chip allocation prioritizing hyperscalers while enterprise customers face 6-9 month lead times for capacity expansion.

gtpi.text: Token pricing at $1.25/1M inputs reflects intense API price compression, forcing providers to optimize model efficiency while commoditization threatens differentiation in the crowded inference market.

gagl.text: AI infrastructure consuming 120 TWh annually creates significant grid strain, with data centers representing 3-4% of US electricity demand and driving urgency for nuclear power adoption to meet carbon commitments.

aipi.text: Current market dynamics show unsustainable cost structures with token commoditization outpacing hardware price normalization, suggesting a bubble risk while AI spending growth accelerates toward $1 trillion annually but lacks corresponding revenue generation models.
